intro: Boerhavia maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan bluemink, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, showy blue or purple flowers. The plant has succulent leaves and stems, which help it conserve water in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Boerhavia maroccana is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
